intro: Dahlia imperialis, commonly known as the Crown of Thorns, is a striking tuberous-rooted plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that come in a wide range of colors, including red, orange, and yellow. The plant features upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its botanical name reflects its historical association with the Passion Play, due to its thorny appearance. Dahlia imperialis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
